Description: Deoxidised handmade pottery drop-shaped jar with a rounded base, formed of a fabric with lots of tiny pieces of straw temper and mica. Some attempt at burnishing made, but surface is generally mottled with firing stains. Two lines of rectangular impressions are 7mm below the rim, with overlapping lines of 6-9 dots. On the shoulder, similar rectangular impressions lines form a zigzag pattern of three lines. In between, touching both, are two animals formed from the same rectangular impressions.
